Speaking of crystals, throughout each village, Croc collects crystals that he can later spend at Swap Meet Pete's shop. Buying items from the shop such as Jump Jelly and Robo Gobbos will allow Croc to explore previously unreachable areas. Croc starts out with three hearts as his life meter, but this number can be increased by heart pots.

The game also feature light puzzle solving elements. These mostly come in the form of hitting switches.
title: Croc 2

description:
After years of watching the Whos of Who-Ville celebrate Christmas, the Grinch has had enough. The Grinch devises a plan to put a stop to this noisy celebration by stealing the villages Christmas presents.

The Grinch is a Pac-Man variant. The game consists of seven scenes divided into several levels. Each level is viewed from a top-down perspective. The levels typically consist of a few screens of the village and also may contain houses which can be entered. In order to complete each level, the Grinch (or his dog Max in some scenes) must collect all the presents scattered around in a set amount of time. The time limit can be extended by finding timer icons. The levels are populated by the Who-Ville citizens who will chase the Grinch if he is spotted, so it's best that the Grinch try to remain as stealthy as possible while snatching presents.

The Grinch only has a limited number of attacks he can perform to stun the villagers who chase him, thus leaving running away as his most used option when spotted by a villager, since a villager can only chase the Grinch for a short amount of time before tiring themselves out. In some levels, the Grinch will be driving a small car while doing his foul deeds. In the Max levels, Max has a jump that he can perform to jump over the dogs who spot him.

sample_screenshots.caption: Yeah, Grinch's tiny heart is going to explode.

title: The Grinch

alternate_titles.title: Batman of the Future: Return of the Joker

description:
Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker is set in a world where Bruce Wayne is of an advanced age and can no longer physically function as his alter ego crime fighter Batman. Thus, Bruce has enlisted a new protege, a teenager named Terry McGinnis, to take over his role as the Batman.

Out one night, Terry gets word from Bruce that Gotham Air & Space has had a break in, At the scene of the crime, Terry runs in to the Jokerz, the Joker's minions, who seem to be stealing high tech parts for some plan devised by the Joker. So now this new Batman must thwart the old Batman's nefarious enemy and disrupt whatever caper he has planned.

The game consists of five levels of beat-'em up actions interspersed with cutscene dialogues throughout that advance the story. The levels feature the occasional branching path, which while leading to the same place, offer the player a chance to face enemies they wouldn't have seen if they kept to a linear path throughout.

Batman can attack his foes with punches and kicks and occasionally use items he finds scattered throughout a level. This additional equipment, which either effects Batman's movement or attacks, includes Batwings, Magnetic Nunchakus, a Dark Knight discus, Boot Jets, a Dark Knight shield, and a Dark Knight staff.
title: Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker

description:
Dale accidentally dropped his acorns into the Magical Kingdoms fireworks machine causing it to malfunction and explode into thirteen pieces that scattered all around the amusement park. So Chip and Dale decide to enlist their friends to help collect the pieces of the machine before nightfall hits. They decide that racing would be the quickest way to get the pieces, and since time is of the essence the pieces should go to the quickest of the friends. Of course, everyone wants to be the hero, so the races won't exactly be that friendly.

Walt Disney World Quest: Magical Racing Tour is side-scrolling kart racer. The selectable racers include Chip, Dale,Amanda Sparkle, Tiara Damage, Bruno Biggs, Moe Whiplash, Otto Plugnut Oliver Chickley III, Polly Roger, Baron Karlott, as well as Jiminy Cricket and two other characters who are unlockable after certain conditions are met.

The regular race tracks include racing at Big Thunder Mountain, Blizzard Beach, Dinosaur (Disney's Animal Kingdom), Rock 'N' Roller Coaster, Haunted Mansion, Jungle Cruise, Tomorrowland Speedway, Space Mountain, Pirates of the Caribbean, and Splash Mountain The races consist of going around the track in three laps against three other opponents. On the track itself are coins that when collected increase the players speed and arrows on the ground called zippers which give the player a temporary burst of speed. There are also Mickey balloons that when ran over are popped and give the player an item which can either help the player or hinder their opponent. Items include acorns, guided bottle rockets, teacup mines, frog spell, turbo, and invincibility, There are also eight fairies on each race course to collect that involves the games unlockable content. Coming in first place earns the player a piece of the fireworks machine.

These race courses can be raced three times each, Once for the machine piece, once for a 1st Place Pennant, and once again for a Trophy Challenge. While the first two are done as races with competitors, the Trophy Challenge just has the player by themselves trying to collect trophies in a limited amount of time.

There are also three Disney Challenge courses where the player has to collect 30 coins before the time expires in order to earn a piece of the fireworks machine. The courses are Test Track (Epcot Center), Typhoon Lagoon, and Disney Studios.

Besides the Adventure mode storyline there is also a Time Trial mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: In Speed Trial, you don't go against any opponents, instead you try to get the fastest time possible.

title: Walt Disney World Quest: Magical Racing Tour

description:
Qix Adventure is a handheld entry in Taito's arcade game series. The main mode of the game is the treasure mode which is more story oriented than previous games in the series. The player controls a character called Speedy whose task is to collect treasure from various beasts.

The gameplay works like previous games but with some differences. Like before a level is completed by capturing 75% of its area and two different enemies (sparx and qix) prevent the player from doing so. What's new is that the playfield also contains one beast and a chest which contains a treasure. The player can collect treasure by first capturing the beast which causes the chest to open and then capturing the object that is revealed. In this way it's possible to capture up to three pieces of treasure per level. There are also various items to collect that gives certain advantages when used.

In addition to the treasure mode there is also a battle mode and a version of the original Qix game.
title: Qix Adventure

description:
Pocket Soccer is a, fast-paced simplified soccer/football game played with teams of five players and two substitutes. One action button is used for shooting, the other for passing the ball or tackling opponents.

The following game modes are available: quick start (randomly picks two teams and a venue), exhibition (lets you chose your team, the opponent team and the venue), playoffs (lets you choose between 8, 16 and 32 teams) and league (where you need to get your team to the top and can trade players as you go). There are 12 fictive venues to choose from (gymnasium, street, beach, schoolyard...).

Each player has their own statistics (stamina, skill, tackling, agility, accuracy, power, teamplay, speed and even IQ) that impact the team as a whole. Besides this, a lot of parameters can be customized, be it for teams for which you can change the name, color, composition and line up, or players for whom you can change the name, gender and facial features.

Also available is a 2-player mode that requires two Game Boy Colors connected by a Game Link cable.
title: Pocket Soccer

description:
Queen of Fighting 2000 is an unlicensed fighting game based on the Neo Geo title SNK Gals Fighters. This game features an all-female roster of fighters to choose from.

Progressing through the single player section of the game takes place after the player chooses one of the 16 selectable characters.

They then have to fight through a random selection of opponents, winning two rounds in each fight to progress to the next. After winning a fight, the game will display a portrait of the character chosen and a line of dialogue. Different difficulty settings can be chosen for the game and there are other game modes: one-on-one and multiplayer matches.

Although the playable characters have their own unique fighting styles, the ending of the game is the same for each character.
title: Queen of Fighting 2000

description:
San Francisco Rush 2049 for Game Boy Color is a loose adaptation of the arcade/console game of the same name. Besides employing 2D graphics appropriate to the platform, it features different tracks and a limited selection of modes and cars.

The game includes five different cars (all of which handle differently) and nine tracks. Only the first track can be chosen from the start. Subsequent tracks are unlocked by placing third place or higher in a circuit race on the previous track. Once a track is unlocked, it can also be used for a time trial race.

The races are shown in a pseudo-3D bird's eye view, with tunnels and signs sometimes obscuring the racers. A major gameplay element is picking up power-up icons: the turbo icon delivers a short speed burst, necessary for beating the competition. There is also a grip icon that temporarily improves handling. Oil slicks on the tracks should be avoided.
title: San Francisco Rush 2049

description:
Cruis'n Exotica for Game Boy Color is an adaptation of the arcade/console racing game of the same name. It reuses several of the original's modes and gameplay mechanics and adds one original mode, but has a smaller selection of cars, and a graphics engine adapted to the handheld platform.

The game includes 12 cars (down from 22 in the console version) and 12 tracks. Only five cars are available from the start, the rest are unlocked by accumulating mileage. The tracks follow the same themes as those in the console version: from exotic locales (Korea, Ireland, Tibet) and cities (Hong Kong, Las Vegas) to far-out fantasy worlds (Atlantis, a prehistoric jungle, Mars). They have however been redesigned to fit the 2D engine, which uses an OutRun-style perspective view of the track, so there are none of the extravagant jumps and drops of the original. The engine offers three different viewing heights to choose from.

The three game modes are Exotica, Freestyle and Circuit. Exotica is the main game mode, consisting of consecutive races on all of the game's tracks. Winning a race is necessary to advance to the next track. In Freestyle mode, all tracks can be accessed for a trial run from the start. Circuit mode is exclusive to the GBC version: it moves through various multi-track rounds, in which final placements determine a point score. Reaching a certain score threshold is necessary to advance to the next round.

The game uses the same trick system as the console version: double-tapping the gas launches the car into a wheelie for a short speed burst. When hitting another car, moves like flips, spins and rolls can be launched through button combos, accelerating the car further.
title: Cruis'n Exotica

description:
Ronaldo V-Soccer is a soccer game endorsed by Brazilian superstar Ronaldo.

It offers a selection of 74 national teams and 40 European club teams. The European release of the game has real player names, but the US release replaces them with fictional ones. The teams can be used in a variety of modes: friendlies, leagues and cups (of either 8, 16 or 32 teams and a choice of neutral stadiums or home/away factoring in) and a practice mode (for full games or penalties). Two special Ronaldo cups are also available: a three-on-one cup and a final four round.

Options include game lengths of two, five or ten minutes, a choice of arcade and simulation mode and the optional golden goal rule for overtime. Before a match, strategy, formations and positions can be set. A match itself is seen from a bird's-eye view, with the field scrolling left to right. Controls allow for shots and passes (with the length of the button press determining the power), tackles and headers.
title: Ronaldo V-Soccer

description:
Wacky Races is an arcade racing game based on the 1960s animated series of the same name. Released in conjunction with versions on consoles, the Game Boy Color version has its own modes and tracks and platform-appropriate graphics.

The game includes eight different characters and their vehicles as seen in the TV series, all with different top speed, handling and acceleration. Only half of the characters are selectable from the start, the rest have to be unlocked by completing several of the game's modes. The races take place over nine tracks located all over the United States, from Alaska to Hawaii and from New York to Oregon.

Four different game modes are available: Arcade mode consists of three different cups of three tracks each. Finishing among the top three is necessary to advance from one track to the next. Endurance mode takes place on shorter variations of the regular tracks. In this mode, the racer in last position gets eliminated after every checkpoint until only the winner remains. Winning a track is necessary to advance to the next. Championship mode goes trough all tracks in order, with points awarded depending on finishing position. Time Trial mode allows the practicing of every track and competing for the best times.

The races are seen from a view behind the racer, with an OutRun-style perspective view of the track. Power-ups lie on the track and can be picked up to unleash a variety of effects. These include self-guided missiles (explosive and freezing) as well as temporary speed-ups and invincibility. The AI opponents use different power-ups that they drop into the player's way, including bombs, mines and oil slicks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Take that thunder storm, you fools!
Winners of the race...you as The Slag Brothers on the 2nd place...

title: Wacky Races

description:
LEGO Stunt Rally for Game Boy Color is a simplified version of the PC game of the same name. While it features the same storyline and environments, the handheld version has platform-appropriate 2D graphics, different track design, and fewer gameplay options.

As in the PC game, the goal in the game's main championship mode is to defeat Mr. X, the top racer of Stunt Island. To be able to compete against Mr. X, four other racers must be defeated first. The championship moves through four environments with five tracks each: city, desert, jungle and ice, followed by the final challenge against Mr. X. Races must be won in order to continue. The quick race mode sets up a race on a random track, while the single race mode can be used to play races on tracks unlocked in the championship.

At the start of the game, four different cars are available, which more available for unlocking by winning races in championship mode. Unlike in the PC game, the cars cannot be customized for different track conditions with wheels or, for visual splendor only, with colors.

Races are seen from a top-down view. Cars corner automatically, with the player only controlling acceleration and lane changes, with the gist of the game thus being slowing down enough before corners so the car isn't thrown off-track while still being fast enough to win. Sometimes, one of the two lanes is blocked, making switching necessary. While there are ramps and jumps in the game, the more extravagant elements of the PC version like jumping through smoke pillars or driving through loops are not present. Power-up pick-ups have also been reduced: the remaining ones are oil slicks, temporary speed-ups, invincibility and perfect grip.

Like the PC version, the handheld version also features a track editor, with more than a dozen constructed tracks being able to be stored via battery backup. Playing through the championship mode unlocks new pieces to be used during construction.

sample_screenshots.caption: Too much speed around the corners results in you coming of the track just like in real-life Scalextric.
The scenery is made of lego.
There are a few different types of car to select.

title: LEGO Stunt Rally

description:
Benjamin Blümchen: Ein verrückter Tag im Zoo ("A Crazy Day at the Zoo") is based on the long-running German children's audio play series starring talking elephant Benjamin Blümchen and his friends. In the game, Benjamin and his friend Otto are hired by newspaper reporter Karla Kolumna to take some photographs of the zoo animals for an article she's writing. This of course leads to all kinds of trouble for the two: they must navigate ice floats to get to the polar bear, take part in an animal race and must get back the camera when it's stolen (twice). Images in comic style illustrate the story between levels.

The game consists of six action-filled levels, with most of them featuring a unique gameplay mechanic. Levels one and six feature Benjamin in a side-scrolling environment. He must avoid household objects come to life or various animals while searching for the stage exit. His health is measured in sugar cubes that get removed if an enemy touches him. He can find new cubes in the levels, but losing them all means restarting the current stage.

Level two takes place underwater. Otto must swim through a cave system, avoiding dangerous plants and animals and periodically coming up for air. It's again Otto's turn in level three, which takes place on a large lake filled with water lily leaves, seen from a bird's eye view. Otto must jump from leaf to leaf to find the level exit. In level four, Benjamin finds himself in the house of zoo director Mr. Tierlieb and gets chased around by a mouse. Seen from a top-down perspective, it is the player's job to guide Benjamin through the house by not bumping into any furniture. Sugar cubes are again available to refill the elephant's health.

Level five is the animal race, consisting of three rounds. Otto rides a zebra and must take on two other children riding a kangaroo and an ostrich. The races are seen from a top-down perspective and consist of several laps. Acceleration pads on the tracks can be ridden over for a short speed boost.

Level progress is saved via passwords. It is always possible to play completed levels again, trying to get a better score by using less tries or by finishing in a better place in the race.
title: Benjamin Blümchen: Ein verrückter Tag im Zoo

description:
NFL Blitz for Game Boy Color is an adaptation of the football game of the same name released on other platforms. While it features the same style of arcade gameplay with loose rules, it has slightly different features and presents everything in platform-appropriate two-dimensional graphics.

Among the deviations from standard NFL football are 30-yard-downs, seven-man teams, legal pass interference, the clock stopping after every play, and the absence of referees. Play modes include exhibition games and a full season with progress saved via password. Quarter length can be set between one and six minutes. Players can select from the 30 teams of the 1998 NFL season. Differences from other versions include different featured star players and the season not following any real-life schedule.

Gameplay is seen from an isometric perspective. The playbook (same as in other versions) includes 18 offensive and 9 defensive plays, which are flippable. On offense, players can engage a turbo to run faster, and launch evasive moves like spins and hurdles while on defense, the controlled player is freely switchable and is capable of diving and tackling.

The Game Boy Printer is supported for printing out stats and passwords.
title: NFL Blitz

description:
Power Spike: Pro Beach Volleyball for the Game Boy Color is the handheld version of the console game with the same name. Like the original game it carries a license to include professional beach volleyball players from the real sport. There are eleven teams in total, six men's teams and five women's teams. The game is played from a side view perspective that scrolls from side to side. The control pad is used for moving around, the A button is used to bump, set, spike and throw the ball while the B is used to jump and block shots.

There are three game modes: single match, championship and versus game. The single match mode is for practising playing the game with any of the included teams. In the tournament mode the player enters competitions that are gradually unlocked. By winning tournaments the player can also unlock secret modes and a hidden court. The versus game is for two player multiplayer matches that are played over a link cable.
title: Power Spike: Pro Beach Volleyball

description:
Nintama Rantarō: Ninjutsu Gakuen ni Nyūgaku Shiyō no Dan is based on the anime Nintama Rantarō. The game is a collection of 6 minigames. Five of these minigames can be accessed through the Shugyō no Maki (修行の巻) option. You can select one of three players for each minigame: Rantarō (乱太郎), KiriMaru (きり丸), and ShinBē (しんベエ).

The first game in this mode is Chōhitsu (跳飛術), where you must wall jump up 15 meters and reach the goal as fast as possible within 60 seconds. The second game is Hōjutsu (砲術), where you must shoot as many targets as possible within 30 seconds. The third game is Shuriken (手裏剣術). This plays similar to Hōjutsu, where you must hit as many targets as possible within 30 seconds. However, the targets move up and down, and you can no longer move your character, and must move the D-pad left or right to aim, as well as pressing up to hit certain targets. The fourth game is Ashikogijutsu (足漕ぎ術), where you must row 30 meters to the goal as fast as possible within 60 seconds. The last minigame in Shugyō no Maki is Eijutsu (泳術). This is similar to Ashikogijutsu; you must swim 30 meters to the goal as fast as possible in 60 seconds. However, you now have a breath meter, which means you must stop paddling when it gets to low and get your breath meter back up.

Finally, there is Taisen no Maki (対戦の巻). In this game, you and your opponent aim to collect all 5 scrolls on the map. If you don't have all the scrolls because your opponent has the rest, you must attack them using one of three weapons; shurikens, spikes, and bombs. These can be picked up on the map and are generated randomly. Once you have all 5 scrolls, you must try to avoid the opponent until the 3-minute timer expires. Whoever has the most scrolls wins the game. You play against two students (who the two students are depends on which character you choose), before finally going up against the teachers Doi and Yamada.

The game offers two-player support in Taisen no Maki, and features the option Kiroku no Maki (記録の巻), which allows the player to look at the high scores attained in the 5 Shugyō no Maki minigames.
title: Nintama Rantarō: Ninjutsu Gakuen ni Nyūgaku Shiyō no Dan

description: Shinseiki Evangelion: Mahjong Hokan Keikaku is a mahjong spin-off game of the Neon Genesis Evangelion anime series. The game is a simple mahjong sim using digitized screenshots from the anime as backdrops. The music is 8-bit renditions of tracks from the series. The game's publisher, King Records, had a hand in the release of CD's featuring music from the series.
title: Shinseiki Evangelion: Mahjong Hokan Keikaku

description:
The Wild Thornberrys: Rambler is a mini-game collection, and the first licensed game based off the television series. The plot of the game involves the family wanting to win the Gold Schweitzer Award for Best Nature Documentary, so they decide to travel the world in order to do so.

There are six different mini-games to play:* Beetle Mania: this game takes place in the African Savannah. Donnie, the show's wild child, is hungry for beetles. The player must collect them for him until he is full.

  • Born to be Free: this game takes place on the Galapagos Islands. Eliza, the show's heroine, must rescue animals that have been trapped in cages by the evil poachers Kip & Neil.

  • Commvee Rally: this game takes place in the Congo. Debbie, Eliza's sister, must drive the commvee to collect CDs from her favourite band, which have been scattered outside due to a rainstorm.

  • Down and Outback: this game takes place in the Australian Outback. The comvee tips over into a ravine and out spills a box of videotapes. Nigel, Eliza's father, has to collect them all while swinging on a rope.

  • Monkey Business: this game takes place in the Amazon Rainforest. A group of marmosets steal the family's video camera, break it into pieces, and scatter it across the rainforest. Darwin, the family's pet monkey, has to collect all the pieces before everyone else comes back.

  • You Ain't Seen Nothin' Yeti: this game takes place in the Himalayas mountains. Marianne, Eliza's mother, decides to capture footage of the elusive Yeti, but she'll have to photograph other animals first.

There are three different difficulty levels - Wild, Wilder, & Wildest - and they each have different endings. The number of items to collect in each game also varies by difficulty mode.
title: The Wild Thornberrys: Rambler

description: Little Nicky is a licenced action game based on the 2000 Adam Sandler film of the same name. Play as Nicky and fight demons, defeat your evil brothers and solve puzzles to save the world. The game features fifteen levels and five mini-games.

sample_screenshots.caption: He died doing what he loved.
This man berates you until you throw a dart at him, so don't feel too bad.
The game starts off with a recreation of the movie.
This is another minigame, Mr Satanhead.

title: Little Nicky

description: Vegas Games includes eight casino games with several variations of each one. The included games are keno, money wheel, baccarat, slots, video poker, craps, roulette and blackjack.
title: Vegas Games

description:
Flipper & Lopaka is a licensed side-scroller based on the Australian cartoon of the same name. The premise of the show is that Flipper the dolphin has taught Lopaka (a native Pacific islander boy) the secrets of the ocean, allowing him to survive underwater for long periods and communicate with sea life. Together the two must usually stop the evil plans of Dexter, a mean octopus.

The game has you trade off between the two characters: Lopaka must find a magic crystal in his sprawling platforming levels, then Flipper must take the crystal and place it on an altar in his Ecco the Dolphin-style levels. Flipper also handles the boss fights, and the bonus levels that are accessed by collecting 100 pearls.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lopaka running in the first level.
The title screen, with the title characters.

title: Flipper & Lopaka

description:
Meitantei Conan: Norowareta Kouro (名探偵コナン 呪われた航路) is a murder mystery adventure game based on Detective Conan manga and anime. Once again, Kudou Shinichi, a teenager with a great deduction skills who got shrank to a body of a 5-year old and now goes by the name of Conan Edogawa, finds himself in the middle of a mystery as boards the cruise liner as one of a participants on a mystery trip.

The game uses bird's eye camera while Conan is moving and investigating areas of interest, and switches to first-person visual novel style gameplay during dialogues or sometimes just uses dialogue window with character portraits over the gameplay scene. As in earlier games in the series, Conan obtains keywords that will help him in his investigation through people's testimonies and item clues.
title: Meitantei Conan: Norowareta Kōro

description: Othello Millennium is a adaptation of Othello/Reversi for Game Boy Color. The main draw is the Story Mode, where players select between a boy or girl as their character and play through a total of five levels of increasing difficulty against animated CPU opponents represented by animals. Before each match, players are asked a series of trivia questions pertaining to Othello, and some strategy questions where they are asked to choose the best move for a given board state; getting these questions right is not necessary to advance the game. They can also skip this mode entirely and just play a single game, selecting between 4 CPU opponents or choosing to play against Guest, which lets them play a two-player game (by handing off the game to a second player between moves).
title: Othello Millennium

description: A billiards game where you collect spirits called Tamapi to store inside balls to affect gameplay when sunk into a pocket, such as shaking the table or getting another turn if you fail to pocket a ball on a turn. Collect more spirits from opponents by defeating them. During the rounds of billiards you can win items such as MiniDiscs to unlock new music for the DJ to play in the background.
title: Pocket Billiards: Funk the 9 Ball

alternate_titles.title: Woody Woodpecker no Go! Go! Racing

description:
Woody Woodpecker Racing is a kart racing game featuring characters from the popular series of cartoons starring Woody Woodpecker. Unlike the associated game for 3D Platforms, the racing is depicted in a top-down 2D view. Gameplay remains heavily modeled on Mario Kart, as the the player races around a track with the usual array of speed boosts, jump ramps, water hazards, and cliffs. Riding over star blocks rewards the player with a random assortment of power-ups and weapons: jump springs, nitro boosts, rockets, oil slicks, invincibility charges, etc. The game begins with six of the ten racers (including Woody and Winnie Woodpecker) unlocked; the rest may be obtained by winning tournaments. A two-player head-to-head racing mode is also supported via the link cable.

There are two tournament modes: Extreme and Grand Prix, each consisting of the same series of twelve three-track tournaments (spread across sixteen distinct racetracks). In Extreme, the player must finish in a minimum qualifying position to advance, resulting in a smaller field of challengers as the tournament goes on; Grand Prix adds some additional challenge by keeping the whole field of competitors throughout and ranking racers with points for their finishing positions. Earning gold trophies in tournaments unlocks points used to equip better car parts for future races across all modes.

All tracks are also available in two practice modes, Sprint and Time Trial. Sprint is a single tournament-style race against a full field of AI racers. Time Trial is a traditional run of an empty track with power-ups disabled; a "ghost car" of the player's best trial time may be enabled for reference.

sample_screenshots.caption: Just steer clear while they're flashing with invincibility.
Just be careful. (Though you don't need to look that nervous.)
Be careful where you aim that homing missile!
And some less standard racing locations.
Or trip them up with a barbell or oil slick.

title: Woody Woodpecker Racing

description: Parallely to the multi-platform release with the identical name Polaris SnoCross for GBC brings snowmobile racing to the handheld. The game has two different game modes: Tournament and Linked Play to compete with a friend. Unlike the 3D console and Windows version the game comes with a 2D topdown perspective. The game contains 10 different tracks and the sled can be upgraded by increasing acceleration, top speed and traction with points rewarded by winning races during the tournament.
title: Polaris SnoCross

description: SWIV on the Game Boy Color is an adaptation of the 1992 SNES version Super SWIV (aka Firepower 2000 in North America). It's a vertical scrolling shooter where the player may choose to pilot a chopper or to drive an attack Jeep. The chopper is not blocked by obstacle, but can only fire straight forward. Unlike the SNES/Genesis version, Jeep and Chopper have same specs: same speed, same armor, same agility. Levels are also 'inspired' by the 1992 version but modified (less long, less enemies). The 2 players mode (one controlling the chopper, the other in the jeep) was also removed.
title: SWiV

description:
Based on the popular NHK anime & manga created by CLAMP, Itsumo Sakura-chan to Issho (Always with Sakura-chan) is a game which makes use of a real-time clock feature to provide variations in gameplay based on the time of day. The player is tasked with utilizing the clock feature to help Sakura locate the Clow Cards, from the perspective of her guide, Cerberus. The player explores various rooms at various times of day in order to find the cards, while also partaking in Sakura's time at school.

Players can utilize a Game Boy Printer to print out themed stickers, including various characters, icons, and whatever text the player enters. Various mini-games are also available.

sample_screenshots.caption: CERBERUS used OSAKA ACCENT! It's super effective! SAKURA is confused!
SAY KIDS WHAT TIME IS IT?
Our resident video camera/cute outfit/stalker(?) girl Tomoyo appears.

title: Cardcaptor Sakura: Itsumo Sakura-chan to Issho

description:
Power Pro-kun Pocket is a 1999 arcade Baseball simulator developed by Diamond Head and published by Konami for the Game Boy Color. It was designed as a spinoff of Jikkyou Pawafuru Puroyakyū 5, and is set apart by its darker storytelling with slight fantasy elements.

The game's main feature is its "Success" story scenario, "Extreme High School Edition", which follows a student who transfers to a very decrepit school and must convince his classmates to join his Baseball team after the club collapses on top of the former corrupt staff. The player must manage the protagonist's weekly routine to train, meet new teammates and date one out of a few love interests. Failing to keep the protagonist healthy, being unable to keep the Baseball club running or losing a late-game match results in a game over which erases the player's save file. One can reset the game to prevent a game over, but there are restrictions and penalties for doing so.

Upon clearing the Success mode with any ending, the player can use the resulting character to build a custom team for playing Baseball on the Exhibition mode. Matches between two people who own the game and a link cable are supported.

In 2004, a compilation remake of this game and its sequel was released for the Game Boy Advance.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu with the Success mode, the Baseball free play and the player's custom character collection.

To draft certain people in the team you need to beat them on minigames. This one is a quick-time-event... which gives the directions in kanji. Oh, and you need to press the direction OPPOSITE of the o
The Baseball club collapses on top of the senior staff, but they were all cheaters, anyway...

title: Power Pro Kun Pocket

description:
Jim Henson's Bear in the Big Blue House is a game based on the TV series of the same name. Today is Ojo's birthday, and there are many things to do. There are two modes: Adventure and Activity.

In Adventure Mode. you travel around the house to find characters to play with. Each character has their own mini-game, and some characters have multiple. Treelo has three mini-games; in the first one you must go through a maze to find a beehive, the second one has you blow bubbles into his mouth, and the final mini-game has you catch feathers. With Tutter, you must catch popcorn while avoiding the burnt popcorn. Pip and Pop also have two mini-games; in the first one you must play a matching game, and in the second, you are a goalie for a game called Pondball. Bear also has two-mini games. In the first one, you must sneak around and unwrap the present while he's not looking. In the second one, you must bounce the stars along so they don't fall. This mode has two difficulties, Easy and Hard. Each time you complete a few levels of a mini-game, you get a puzzle piece. Get all of the puzzle pieces to win.

Activity Mode is just the mini-game without the house and the puzzle. You do not get puzzle pieces in this mode. You can also choose easy or hard.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can choose between adventure and activity mode.

title: Jim Henson's Bear in the Big Blue House

description:
Bob the Builder: Fix it Fun! is a game based on the British television series of the same name. Bob and Wendy are having a big picnic, but there is a lot of work to do beforehand. Each of Bob's friends has work to get done. Roley must flatten the road in time for the picnic. Lofty must save ducklings before they run off-stream. Dizzy must help Spud collect all the apples for the picnic. Muck must help Farmer Pickles fix his wall.

Not only do the machines have to do jobs, Bob and his other colleagues have work to do. Bob must find tiles that blew off of the Town Hall roof, music sheets that blew off the bandstand, packages that Spud stole, and pieces to mend the fence. Bob must also feed Pilchard, the pet cat. All of Bob's tasks are platformer mini-games, with many different areas to explore and a key to unlock an area. These sections are based on health-based rather than time-based. Once all the tasks are compete, you must play as Scoop and collect all the things for the picnic. There are three difficulties; easy. medium, and hard, which change the difficulty of the mini-games (less time, objects are more hidden, etc.)

sample_screenshots.caption: An example of a platformer level.

title: Bob the Builder: Fix it Fun!

description: Cubix: Robots for Everyone - Race 'n Robots is a racing game based on the television series of the same name. There are three tracks to choose from at the start; four additional tracks can be unlocked by finding keys throughout the races. There are many different robots to choose from, each with different stats. Each race is three laps long, and there are many items that can affect your race. Blue pickups let you boost while red pickups stop you in your tracks. After completing the three original tracks in first place, you fight a boss, Holossal. You do this by defeating him in a versus race. There are also shortcuts along the way.
title: Cubix: Robots for Everyone - Race 'n Robots

description: Doug's Big Game is a game based on the animated television series of the same name. In this game, you play as Doug, going around town and talking to friends and family. Your main goal is to find Patti, Doug's crush, as she does not show up on time. Along the way, Doug meets many familiar faces, including his parents, his sister Judy, and his friends like Skeeter, Beebe, and Chalky. They will give you clues as to where Patti may be. Doug also has Quailman segments, where Doug imagines that he is a superhero by the name of Quailman, and must do certain things like defeat a boss or clear a path. Each time you do this, you get a password. Do this enough times to eventually find Patti and win the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...but their lines are extremely limited and often repeat.
A password is given after a clue is found.
"This game can only be played on Game Boy Color."

title: Disney's Doug: Doug's Big Game

description: Dragon Tales: Dragon Wings is a game based on the animated series Dragon Tales. At the start, you get to choose between two dragons; Org and Cassie, and also pick your difficulty. Your main goal, as a dragon, is to take lessons for flight, each with a specific goal. Each lesson has a set amount of missions to complete. Some are as simple as flying to a specific spot, while others are more elaborate and have multiple steps. Berries can also be collected to make new records. These missions are also timed, giving the player more of an incentive to play the lessons again to achieve the high score. Other missions have you pick up objects and move them to a certain place. There are 15 lessons in total, and some need to be unlocked by completing other lessons. A sliver trophy is given for a completion, and a golden trophy is given for a 100% completion.

sample_screenshots.caption: "This game is designed only for use on Game Boy Color."
Objects can be picked up, like children and rocks.

title: Dragon Tales: Dragon Wings

description:
E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial: Digital Companion is a game based on the classic 1982 film E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial. First, E.T. asks you many questions, like your first and last name, zip code, address, and favorite things. Then, a planner is set up that you can use daily. It includes a clock, a calendar, a clock, and a "To-Do List" where you can list tasks that need to be done. You can also print anything that needs to be remembered on the Game Boy Printer.

The main "game"of this digital companion are the five included mini-games. In "Bicycle Race," you race the clock as Elliot, while jumping on ramps and avoiding obstacles. "Trivia" is a simple trivia game asking you questions about the E.T. movie or simply space in general. "Tile Puzzle"is a simple tile puzzle with three difficulties, each with more pieces. "Pair Up" is simply a matching game that counts how many moves you do. "World Scramble" is just a world scrambling game, with two hints for each word. You can also take care of your own Flopglopple by playing, feeding, and talking with it. Earning points in mini-games gives you pictures to unlock.
title: E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial: Digital Companion

description:
You are the famous Stuntman Evel Knievel from the 70s and must finish 20 levels without hitting the ground with your head.

Basically its a physics-driven 2D Motocross game, today known as Elasto Mania or Trials. Technically it has realtime physics with high framerates on the hardware of the Gameboy Color.

sample_screenshots.caption: Full speed to not hit the platform.
Jump through all rings to finish the level.

title: Evel Knievel

description:
Alfred's Adventure stars our "plucky" hero Alfred Chicken. Alfred must battle his way through to rescue Billy Egg who has been "poached" by the fowl Meka-Chickens for their bizarre cloning "eggs-periment". Alfred, the all round good egg, must stop their evil bid to take over the world but surely he is up to the task. After all, he's not chicken. is he?

The game is a simple platformer and the remake of the gameboy version.
title: Alfred's Adventure

description:
Power Pro-kun Pocket 2 is a 2000 arcade Baseball simulator developed by Diamond Head and published by Konami for the Game Boy Color. The simple simulator works the same as it did in the first game, but now 12 teams of the Japanese league are available for free play.

The game's main feature is its Success story scenario, "Drill Moglars Edition", which follows a new protagonist: a professional ballplayer who's been drafted into the Moglars, a small-time team owned by the Drill corporation. With the team already facing the threat of dissolution from severe mismanagement and outstanding debts, the protagonist must strive to lead them to the top of the Japanese league. Unlike how most Jikkyou Pawafuru Puroyakyū games feature a negative continuity with the same cast of characters always at the same age, Pawapoke 2 starts to expand the setting from Pawapuro 5 across a storyline that spans over 30 years.

The player must manage the protagonist's weekly routine to train, meet new teammates and date one out of a few love interests. Failing to keep the protagonist healthy, losing too much reputation or losing any late-game matches once again results in a game over which erases the player's save file. It is possible to reset the game to prevent that, but there are restrictions and penalties for doing so.

Clearing the Drill Moglars scenario enough times reveals "War", the "Inner Success" scenario. This new story sees the protagonist exploring warzones during World War II. Its highlight is the Minesweeper gameplay with unusual rules: the player must guide the protagonist to the top of each board while looking out for mines and collecting items with unknown effects.

Upon clearing either Success mode, the player can use the resulting character to build a custom team for playing Baseball on the Exhibition mode. Matches between two people who own the game and a link cable are supported. Characters can also be swapped between players, and they'll keep certain attributes that are needed to unlock the harem ending for Drill Moglars and the truth behind the War scenario.

In 2004, a compilation remake of this game and its prequel was released for the Game Boy Advance.

sample_screenshots.caption: They sure get mad a lot.
Hero 2 is ready to start his Baseball career, but are the Moglars any good?
Team selection screen for Exhibition mode. Two custom teams can be created.

title: Power Pro Kun Pocket 2

description: You can play billiard games with monster-like characters that are shown at the start of match in a "VS" screen like in many fighting games. The game itself is a typical billiard variation. You can see your character and your enemy interacting at the top of the screen. Also the game has a freely rotatable 3D billiard table and realtime physics on the limited Gameboy hardware.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ball about to go in pocket

title: 3D Pocket Pool

description: Terrifying 911 is unofficial port of Metal Slug 1. The game contains 6 levels. Also, the game is featured an opening FMV containing actual footage of the World Trade Center's twin towers being attacked.
title: Terrifying 911

description:
Survival Kids 2: Dasshutsu!! Futago-Jima! is the Japan-exclusive sequel to Survival Kids.

In this game, the player is offered to choose between two playable characters who are brothers. The brothers were planning to go camping when suddenly, a group of treasure hunters have stolen their grandfather's treasure map and kidnapped the boys. Depending on the choice in the beginning of the game, players may start the game imprisoned or on the shore of one of the seemingly deserted Twin Islands.

In a similar manner to the previous game, Survival Kids 2 is an Action RPG game where players need to survive by getting enough rest and regularly eating and drinking. Certain food such as mushrooms can have varying effects on the character including paralyzing or poisoning him, while other food can go rotten and make the protagonist sick if they eat it. Some food also requires cooking to be actually useful to the protagonist. The sequel also adds an extra character: a talking parrot, which can be used to assist players in different situations, as well as offer hints, provided that players give him food.

The game also features a crafting system, which allows players to create a number of different items by combining two or three items. Plenty of useless items can also be made and found in addition to the ones essential to complete the game so players may need to think as to what they should take with them or throw away.

There are 6 endings in total with slight variations of each of them, depending on whether the player had rescued the protagonist's brother or not.

sample_screenshots.caption: If there's a bed and a box nearby, you'll be given additional sleeping options in the menu.
To get to a locked room, we must solve this button puzzle.
You meet a parrot who gets your knife back and helps you get the cell keys.
The hunter and her goons stole a map.

title: Survival Kids 2: Dasshutsu!! Futago-Jima!

description:
Käpt'n Blaubär: Die verrückte Schatzsuche is a puzzle game centered around the German TV character Käpt'n Blaubär.

Players control Käpt'n Blaubär in levels made up of tiles. The goal is for players to help Käpt'n Blaubär walk over a set amount of star tiles per level and then make it to a life preserver tile to finish the level. The tricky part comes as when Käpt'n Blaubär walks over a star tile it instantly converts to a pool of water which will cost Käpt'n Blaubär his life if he enters it. So players have to contemplate on how to move Käpt'n Blaubär or else they can unwittingly cut of his path and trap him in an unwinnable situation. The game worlds also have some other types of tiles to contend with like conveyor belts and wood tiles that crack and will cost Käpt'n Blaubär his life if he stands on them for too long.

The game consists of 6 worlds made up of 15 levels each for a total of 90 puzzles to solve. In between worlds there is a small mini-game in which Käpt'n Blaubär pilots a submarine and has to avoid crashing into ocean life and also has to collect air bubbles so the subs oxygen doesn't deplete.
title: Käpt'n Blaubär: Die verrückte Schatzsuche

description: Sonic Adventure 7 is unlicensed Sonic game for Game Boy Color. The gameplay similar to the previous game but with different levels and music.

sample_screenshots.caption: The opening "cutscene", which is obviously stolen from Sonic & Knuckles.
Oops, I got myself into a bit of a painful situation.

title: Sonic Adventure 7

description: A handheld version of European Super League. However the action is viewed in 2D from a bird's eye view perspective. The soccer field is laid out vertically.

sample_screenshots.caption: The players are ready for Kick Off

title: Mia Hamm Soccer Shootout

alternate_titles.title: L'Ile Lego 2: La Revanche de Casbric

description:
Players control Pepper Roni, a pizza delivery boy. After a pizza delivery to a jail goes awry, the criminal Brickster escapes, and since Pepper is responsible for this predicament, he must set things right and send Brickster back to the hoosegow.

The game is meant for children so gameplay is kept relatively simple. Pepper travels around Lego Islands on his skateboard. However parts of the island are inaccessible until Pepper delivers a particular item to the person who is blocking his path. Delivering the item is how the narrative of the story progresses. Also, finding hidden Lego character cards is the games reward for observant exploration of the island. The game contains dozens of cards to collect.

Although Pepper can't be killed, he will have to deal with enemies by either bumping into them or stunning them with a pizza throw.

sample_screenshots.caption: He got out using a Pizza???
These cards can be seen by pushing Select.

title: LEGO Island 2: The Brickster's Revenge

sample_screenshots.caption: Military mission. Screw "Top Gun" for now.
Italy. First mission. I must reach the tower of Pisa.
Where is the ancient building? Just check the strategy map...

description: Cyborg Kuro-chan: Devil Fukkatsu!! is a 2D rail shooter based on the Cyborg Kuro-chan manga and anime series. Players take control of the titular cat Kuro, a formerly normal housecat who survives being turned into a cyborg and sets out to take revenge on the mad scientist who did it to him with the help of his new cyborg weaponry. The 2D sidescrolling levels scroll automatically. Instead of controlling Kuro, players use the d-pad to control a crosshair to aim and shoot. With his array of cyborg weaponry, players can shoot down enemies and blow up the scenery. In addition, players can use the B button to make Kuro jump in order to dodge obstacles. At the beginning of every level, players can customize Kuro's weapon loadout; as the game progresses, players gain access to new guns they can equip. During levels, players can use the select button to toggle between all equipped weapons.

sample_screenshots.caption: Picking our loadout! At the start of the game, players only have these two guns and a single melee weapon.
For the most part Kuro moves himself, but players do have the ability to jump.
There are a few obstacles on the ground that Kuro has to jump over to avoid taking damage.
A lot of buildings drop powerups after they're destroyed.

title: Cyborg Kuro-chan: Devil Fukkatsu!!

description: Cyborg Kuro-chan 2: White Woods no Gyakushū is a 2D rail shooter based on the Cyborg Kuro-chan manga and anime series. Players take control of the titular cat Kuro, a formerly normal housecat who survives being turned into a cyborg and sets out to take revenge on the mad scientist who did it to him with the help of his new cyborg weaponry. This entry plays exactly the same as the previous game. The 2D sidescrolling levels scroll automatically. Instead of controlling Kuro, players use the d-pad to control a crosshair to aim and shoot. With his array of cyborg weaponry, players can shoot down enemies and blow up the scenery. In addition, players can use the B button to make Kuro jump in order to dodge obstacles. At the beginning of every level, players can customize Kuro's weapon loadout; as the game progresses, players gain access to new guns they can equip. During levels, players can use the select button to toggle between all equipped weapons.

sample_screenshots.caption: Just like in the last game, buildings are there to be blown up.
There's a lot more ground-based enemies this time around.

title: Cyborg Kuro-chan 2: White Woods no Gyakushū

sample_screenshots.caption: Let's get a bouquet of flowers for Mom

title: Microsoft: The Best of Entertainment Pack

alternate_titles.title: Disneys Winnie Puuh und Tigger auf Honigsafari

title: Disney's Pooh and Tigger's Hunny Safari

alternate_titles.title: Walt Disney Biancaneve e i Sette Nani
Walt Disney Blancanieves y los Siete Enanitos
Walt Disney Blanche-Neige et les Sept Nains
Walt Disney's Sneeuwwitje en de Zeven Dwergen
Walt Disneys Schneewittchen und die Sieben Zwerge
Walt Disneys Snehvide og de syv små Dværge
Walt Disneys Snehvit og de syv Dvergene
Walt Disneys Snövit och de sju Dvärgarna

sample_screenshots.caption: ...the hunter tells Snow White to hide in the forest.

title: Walt Disney's Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

description:
Bomberman Selection is a compilation of the first two Game Boy Bomberman titles for Game Boy Color on a single cartridge:

  • Bomber Boy
  • Bomberman GB
title: Bomberman Selection

alternate_titles.title: Le Diablo de Tasmania: Le Tourbillon Vorace

description:
Tasmanian Devil: Munching Madness is a video game for the Game Boy Color staring the Tasmanian Devil, a character from the Looney Tunes. The game starts with Bull Gator and Axel kidnaping Taz friend Wendal T. Wolf. Taz now has to save him before he is being sold to a circus in Las Vegas.

The game is a platform game played from an overhead perspective. In the game the players take control of Taz to eat all the food in each of the nine levels - Tasmania, Australia, China, Greece, Switzerland, Amsterdam, Amazon River, Las Vegas and Transylvania. On the way, the player must also collect medallions and can attack enemies by using Taz's signature spin or by spitting.

The game uses a password save system.
title: Tasmanian Devil: Munching Madness

sample_screenshots.caption: Ball has reached the other side of the field

alternate_titles.title: Noddy y la Fiesta de Cumpleaños

description: Sesame Street: Elmo's 123s is based on the 1980s computer game Astro Grover. In this conversion Grover is swapped out for the character Elmo, who was popular for Sesame Street in the 1990s and 2000s. Elmo needs to help aliens with numbers in order to build their house.
title: Sesame Street: Elmo's 123s

description: Sesame Street: Elmo's ABCs is based on the 1980s computer game Letter-Go-Round. Instead of Sesame Street characters, such as Big Bird, Elmo finds a letter that goes merry-go-round to saying how the letters were. They solve by checking the controls to determine the letter.
title: Sesame Street: Elmo's ABCs

description: Tottoko Hamtaro: Tomodachi Daisakusen Dechu is a small pet simulator in Japanese that features the anime-character Hamtaro.
title: Tottoko Hamtaro: Tomodachi Daisakusen Dechu

description: Ottifanten: Kommando Störtebeker is an auto-running 2D platformer. Baby Bruno goes on a search after his missing teddy bear Honk, through four worlds of six stages each. Shares a name with the Ottifants movie, but seems to be otherwise unrelated, especially in terms of plot.
title: Ottifanten: Kommando Störtebeker

description: Kirikou is a 2D side-scrolling platform game based on the 1998 French animated movie Kirikou et la Sorcière. Players guide the small boy Kirikou through nine levels as he sets out to confront Karaba the sorceress and free the village warriors. Kirikou explores the environments, attacks opponents with a knife and collects objects. Levels have a lot of verticality and platforms are connected through ladders. Each level has a set amount of objects to collect, also shown in the HUD, but levels can be completed by reaching the exit as collecting them is not a requirement to progress. After each level a password is provided.
title: Kirikou

description:
In the fictional kingdom of Iraldi, monster-hunting tournaments are held in dungeons across the land. The winner of the tournament is the team who defeats the strongest monster.

A top-down strategy game set in a dungeon. Your sight is limited, hide in the shadows and move around to reveal more of the dungeon and lead your team to victory.
title: Kakurenbo Battle: Monster Tactics

description:
Arthur's Absolutely Fun Day! is a mini-game collection based on the characters from the picture books by Marc Brown including Arthur, D.W., Francine, Muffy, Buster and more. The first ten games are accessed by directing Arthur around a map of Elwood City. Arthur earns gold stars by completing them and after sixteen stars he earns a pass to enter the amusement park Wonderworld where five more mini-games become available. The ten starting mini-games are:* Cooking pancakes at Grandma Thora's House. 10 pancakes are required for a star.

  • Delivering door-to-door newspapers. Arthur must deliver 10 newspapers to get a star.
  • Diving for treasure. Arthur must collect a certain amount of treasures and then he is given a star.
  • Going berry picking at Wanda's Berry Farm. Arthur must collect 10 berries to get a star.
  • Playing air hockey with Buster. Arthur must score 7 times to get a star.
  • Playing basketball with Francine. Arthur must score 10 times to get a star.
  • Racing against Brain. Arthur must beat him to the finish line in order to collect a star.
  • Skateboarding and picking up trash. 10 pieces are required for a star.
  • Sorting books at the Elwood City Public Library. 10 books must be sorted to get a star.
  • Sorting candy at The Sugar Bowl. 10 candies must be sorted for a star.

All games can be played over and over again. In Wonderworld games cannot be completed, so players either quit or just keep playing. Also no more stars are awarded there. The five games in Wonderworld are:* Bumper cars.

  • Hitting a circle to ring a bell.
  • Spraying a target with water to raise a hot-air balloon.
  • Skeeball.
  • Throwing balls at a dunk tank target.
title: Arthur's Absolutely Fun Day!

description:
Test Drive: Cycles is an entry in the Test Drive racing series focusing on motorcycles in street racing environments. The races are done against opponents, but there is also regular traffic that needs to be avoided. Races are set in locations all around the world such as North America, Indonesia and the Netherlands.

The game modes are Single Race, Tournament, Two Player and Cop Chase. The Tournament mode consists of six cups (Rookie, Touring, Adrenaline, Challengers, Road King and Continental) unlocked gradually. By winning races power-ups and money is earned. The latter is used to buy new motorcycles. Power-ups provide access to upgrades in the categories acceleration, top speed, traction and speed bursts (nitro). Parts can be upgraded several times.
title: Test Drive: Cycles

description:
Elmo lost his blanket and must dive into Oscar the Grouch's trash can, which goes to Grouchland, to retrieve it. Based on the Sesame Street movie Elmo in Grouchland, the game takes the player, or Elmo, through six normal platformer levels and two unique platformers. While one involves the descent into Grouchland, the other involves riding a mine cart. This game takes the player from Sesame Street to Huxley's House. The player can play with or without sound effects, with or without music, and in easy or hard mode.

When starting the game, the player starts with three lives. He/she can gain many extra lives throughout the game. If all lives are lost, the player can either choose to continue with three more lives or choose to go straight to the Game Over screen and credits. After the player loses all lives three times, chooses to end the game, or completes all eight stages, the game is concluded.
title: The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland

description:
The Nations: Land of Legends is a 2D action adventure game played from a bird's-eye perspective based on the better known PC game The Nations. The planet of the Pimmons, Amazons and Sajikis is threatened by a fire-breathing monster and the nations have to work together to defeat it.

The game starts with a Pimmon called Palemmos arriving in a new village. Quests like looking for a missing sheep and finding materials for a weapon have to be completed. Once the player has obtained a club, they can kill the hostile critters in the woods and the beach. Later on, Palemmos learns to levitate. In the village are several characters that can help the player, like a woodcarver, a weapon trainer and a merchant. The player will also get to play as the Amazon Hamani, who can kill critters with a bow and has the ability to swim, as well as the Sajiki Kassass, who is armed with an energy weapon and can walk through fire. The game uses a password save system.
title: The Nations: Land of Legends

description:
No Fear Downhill Mountain Biking is a 2D side-scrolling mountain bike racing game carrying the US No Fear lifestyle clothing brand. Players can choose between different racers with four main statistics: balance, power, recovery and stamina. There is a bike setup for every track based on the conditions, covering the tyres, gear ratio, brakes, suspension, frame and wheels.

Races are often done head-to-head where opponents can be hindered. There are obstacles to avoid and a track to navigate. Peddling at the highest rate all the time is not possible because there is a stamina meter involved, so speed needs to be built up carefully with moments of recovery.

The game mode are Championship (with three difficulty levels: Amateur, Pro and Elite), Single Race, Time Trial, Tournament, Duel and Trick Track. The game keeps track of the highest scores.
title: No Fear Downhill Mountain Biking

description: The land of Hinamoto is overrun by the army of the Demon King. Prince Homuramaru stands to fight the evil forces and reclaim his place, aided by his two animal buddies. Players navigate the samurai prince in a number of platform levels in a stage, fighting evil minions and solving puzzles. The player has three different weapons which serve to eliminate different enemies and their mechanics aiding with certain puzzles. Sometimes the player will need to lure enemies to particular spots to trigger mechanisms. At the end of a stage, the player will need to use special tactics to defeat a boss.
title: Samurai Kid

description:
Pro Darts is a sports game that simulates darts. Games can be played against a computer opponent with different difficulty levels or a human player, taking turns controlling the device. Some of the supported game types are 301, 501, 501 double out, around the world, and cricket. A custom player character can be created with different statistics for accuracy, nerves, power and speed.

The moves are simulates in steps. The first one involved stopping the hand moving across the board. Next the position of the hand needs to determined along with a rolling meter that controls the power of the throw.
title: Pro Darts

alternate_titles.title: La Gran Aventura de los Pitufos

description: The Dukes of Hazzard: Racing for Home is a 2D title based on The Dukes of Hazzard franchise that is different from the console / PC version of the same name. The Dukes need to outrun the police in different missions and the vehicle can be driven in different directions, not following a strict path, dodging obstacles.
title: The Dukes of Hazzard: Racing for Home

description: TOCA Touring Car Championship is a 2D racing game based on the British touring car championships that is different from the console versions. Races can be done as single races or championships. The racing is simplified compared to the console versions. All circuits are unlocked from the start. There is multiplayer support for up to eight players taking turns.
title: TOCA Touring Car Championship

description: Colin McRae Rally is a 2D rally simulation game and it is different from the console versions as the game is played from a bird's-eye view in a 2D-scrolling environment with a more arcade approach. There are several difficulty levels, tracks and licensed cars. The main game modes are Time Trial, Rally and Championship.
title: Colin McRae Rally

description:
Caesars Palace II is a casino gambling game that plays similarly to Super Caesars Palace. The player takes control of an unnamed character and chooses various casino games by walking the player character around the casino. There are up to eight games: Blackjack, Mini Baccarat, Roulette, Poker Challenge, Video Poker, Slot Machines, Video Keno, and Big 6. Poker Challenge, Video Poker, and Slot Machines all have a few different variations that can be played.

The goal of the game is to accumulate enough money to gain entry into the High Roller rooms. However, the game has no ending, and the player can play and accumulate as much money as they desire. The player can also visit the banker to take out or repay loans.

The game introduces new mechanics to its Game Boy predecessor. The most notable functions are the Bet Unit and Speed Bet options. The Bet Unit presents the player with several values of chips that the player can use to increase (with the A button) and decrease (with the B button) their bets. However, the player must bet within the table limits. Speed Bet allows the player to automatically bet the same amount of money as they previously did and start a game immediately.

Other features allow the player to load and save their progress, edit their name, and view statistics.
title: Caesars Palace II

description:
In the Game Boy Color version of Sesame Street Sports, children are pitted against their favorite Sesame Street characters in six athletic activities. The characters in these activities include Grover, Ernie, Zoe, Telly, Cookie Monster and Elmo. Unlike the PlayStation version, the game has 2D graphics.

This game was created with young children in mind. It has a special vocal tutorial that teaches even the youngest players how to play.

sample_screenshots.caption: "Elmo reach the finish line just like this"

title: Sesame Street Sports

description:
Mary-Kate and Ashley: Pocket Planner includes a journal, a calendar, a calculator, and a stopwatch, among other things. It may be used to construct "to-do" lists and schedule appointments for girls. When you hold your Game Boy or Game Boy Color up to any touch-tone phone, the phone book will automatically dial numbers for you. Save data about yourself and your pals, then use the Pocket Planner to evaluate the data, including determining which of your friends are the most compatible. Make a list of secret messages and send them to a friend's Mary-Kate and Ashley Pocket Planner.

The Pocket Planner also comes with four games and unlockable goodies such as photographs of the twins that can be printed with the Game Boy Printer, which is available separately. "Ask Ashley," a tool where you may seek for solutions to critical issues, and the "Crush Tester" are two more features.
title: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Pocket Planner

description: Fix & Foxi: Episode 1 - Lupo is a 2D side-scrolling platformer based on the German Fix & Foxi comic and cartoon franchise by Rolf Kauka. The main character Lupo is kicked out of his tower after having the ownership certificate stolen. Now he has to jump and run through five stages and defeat their bosses in order to get the pieces of the certificate back, before the tower is razed for the construction of a shopping center.
title: Fix & Foxi: Episode 1 - Lupo

description: Rescue Heroes: Fire Frenzy allows the player to become a member of the Rescue Heroes team. It consists of several mini-games where a problem needs to be solved or someone or something needs to be rescued. Each one has very different gameplay or perspectives. At the start of the game the player needs to sign in as a rookie, an officer, a captain or a specialist. The game also has support for the Game Boy Printer, allowing players to print images.
title: Rescue Heroes: Fire Frenzy

sample_screenshots.caption: You must match the correct elements in this training mini-game.
Barbie has been delivered the lunch and she will be rewarded.
Choosing one of the six vehicles.
A short cutscene shown before things get, well, "extreme".

title: Extreme Sports with The Berenstain Bears

sample_screenshots.caption: You must arm the skirt puzzle in this mini-game to earn a new one.
You must catch the correct shoe here.
You must follow the pipes through the labyrinth to make the perfume drop fill the bottle at end.
I spy a deer with my binoculars

alternate_titles.title: Kuma no Pooh-san: Mori no Takaramono

title: Disney's Winnie the Pooh: Adventures in the 100 Acre Wood

description:
Based off the BBC children's television series The Tweenies, this game, which can be played in English, Italian, Dutch, or Spanish, has the player complete minigames to help Doodles the dog find his bones in easy, medium, or hard mode. Before he could dig them out of the ground, he must collect eight missing pieces of the garden map. To obtain each piece of the map, the player must play the first said amount of minigames in any order, each awarding the player with one piece if success happens. Four involve meeting one of the Tweenies in the garden; the other four involve going to the Tweenie Clock inside the playroom to choose a game. Upon going in front of the clock or character and selecting it/him/her, the player gets the choice of accepting or rejecting a chance of playing the minigame. Selecting the right arrow towards the top of the screen means accepting a challenge; selecting the left one, which is also towards the top, means the opposite.

At the Tweenie Clock, if the player chooses the right arrow, the clock will go through the clockwise space selection slowly enough for the player to select which game to play. There are five spaces; four of those spaces can be landed on, while the "News Time" space (the orange one resembling the show's iconic six-circle icon) corresponds to the ninth and very last minigame to play. The player has eight misses before failing for easy mode, seven for medium, and six for hard.

In "Telly Time" (when the green space with the television is selected), the player, as Milo, must match the item show below the television with the items scrolling through the TV screen The items scroll faster as the difficulty rises. In "Messy Time" (when the blue space with the splotch is selected), the player plays Jake, who must drop pieces of clay into moving buckets with matching colors. The buckets scroll faster with higher difficulty. "Story Time" (when the red space with the book is selected) has the player, or Fizz, place items into illustrations corresponding to their stories. Different stories are portrayed for each difficulty. During "Song Time" (when the yellow space with eighth notes is selected), the player, as Bella, must correctly repeat certain patterns played first by the game itself. Patterns overall become more complicated for each higher difficulty.

The garden minigames are side-scrolling ones, which involve collecting eight items; collecting stars in those minigames mean filling the endurance bar completely again. The endurance bar always lowers for every hit or attack that happens; for hard, it also lowers due to extended time spent in a minigame. More enemies and more complex versions of tasks are included in harder difficulties. When selecting Milo, the player can play as him in another minigame; he is a clown under a circus tent, and he must find all skittles to win. The player, upon selecting Jake (or as he likes to be known, Dotman), must collect all blue shells underwater. When playing as Fizz, the player must bloom all plants in the castle to win. In the forest as Bella, the player must collect all bananas in the jungle.

After all eight minigames are successfully done, all the map pieces have been retrieved. Now, the player must go back to the Tweenie Clock to choose "News Time," which allows to play the last minigame. The player, as Doodles, must dig up all of the missing bones in the garden. After the player succeeds, he/she wins.
title: Tweenies: Doodles' Bones

sample_screenshots.caption: Celebrating a win with just one peg remaining.
If there are no more valid peg jumping moves, you've lost.
Peg Fun is identical to Pegs Away!, except the starting blank spot is no longer in the middle.
After solving the classic cross shape, try the hexagonal Pegs Away!
After clearing the stage, here's the results of collected chocolates.
