Kelly explores the island to find friends and minigames.
Any of the minigame activities can be directly selected from the Free Play menu.
Each time Kelly wins a minigame, one of her friends returns to the clubhouse.
Collect flags and jump barriers in Unicorn Jump.
Choose your driver from the animated series.
Racing through the streets of Europe.
After clearing the stage, here's your animal friend card.
The first animal card and its description.
Your opponents in first game day.
Get ready to compete in the 100m dash.

alternate_titles.title: E.T. The Extra Terrestrial: The 20th Anniversary

title: E.T. The Extra Terrestrial: Escape from Planet Earth
E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial and the Cosmic Garden

description: Moomin's Tale is a simple platformer based off of the anime adaptation of the Finnish Moomin comic series. Players control Moomintroll, one of the comic's main characters, as he runs errands and helps out others in small adventures. Most of the game is basic 2D platforming, while between levels players explore Moominvalley from an overhead perspective.
title: Moomin's Tale

description: One Piece: Maboroshi no Grand Line Bōkenki! is a role-playing game based on the mange One Piece. It goes through the story from Loguetown to the islands on the Grand Lines. It includes multiple of the original characters. The turn-based battle system includes an adrenaline gauge and once filled it can be used for special moves.
title: One Piece: Maboroshi no Grand Line Bōkenki!

description:
An ivory rabbit called Aster Dandelion ventures into the heart of the forest during a picnic and aids an injured fairy. She is left with a magical pendant that has a mysterious power that turns reality into dreams at the stroke of six in the evening. Now Aster has a quest to return the pendant to Fairyland while she tries to carry on with her daily life.

In Sylvanian Families: Otogi no Kuni no Pendant the player navigates Aster around Sylvania Village, talking to her acquaintances, interacting with objects and completing various tasks, whether she’s at home, school or at a friend’s house. Various mini-games must be won to earn seeds for growing flowers as well as furniture to decorate Aster’s bedroom. There’s also optional side quests such as sprinkling vividust on wilted flowers.
title: Sylvanian Families: Otogi no Kuni no Pendant

description:
The Fairyland fairies have accidentally dropped cloud seeds, causing them to grow clouds all over Sylvania. The fairies beckon Willow Cottontail to recover the seeds and dissipate the clouds that have grown.

Throughout Sylvanian Melodies: Mori no Nakama to Odori Masho!, the player must press three different buttons in time to incoming objects on the screen to get the correct musical rhythm. Higher scores are obtained with accurate and synchronized hits, allowing the player to level up, while misses make the player level down. In each round, the player must obtain a good hit ratio to pass.
title: Sylvanian Melodies: Mori no Nakama to Odori Masho!

sample_screenshots.caption: The first level is full of alien invaders: like the old time... :-D
After some time, the classic UFO will appear in the screen top: shoot it!

description:
Jagainu-kun is a rhythm game based on the anime of the same name.

The story of the game is that Jagainu-kun and Haripoteto-chan are walking through the forest one day, and come across Nasuinu-kun spinning around. Nasuinu-kun is preparing for a dance party. Haripoteto-chan decides to go to the dance party, and the three of them head to the dance party. However, Jagainu-kun had never danced before, but decides to go, thinking he can learn to dance while he's there.

In the game, the opponent (or dance partner) demonstrates a set of moves that must be copied by the player, Jagainu-kun. You are judged on how well you copied the opponent's dance moves, indicated by a weather mark. The sunnier the weather, the better your performance is. The goal of each stage is to beat each one with sunny weather. Beating each stage with sunny weather not only unlocks more songs, but also more friends, who are added to your "Friend Files" (トモダチファイル). "Friend Files" will give a brief description of each character unlocked. They can also be unlocked by different means, such as using the Communication Exchange mode.

Here are the main modes of play:

Story Mode (ストーリーモード): Jagainu-kun (controlled by the player) must compete in several dances against several characters. Clearing this mode 100% will unlock a new mode; Communication Battle, in which the player can compete with a human opponent (see below).

Picture Book (えほん): The cutscenes in the Story Mode are changed into a picture book that the player can view. There are four of them that can be unlocked by clearing all stages in the Story Mode, including the hidden stages. However, they differ depending on how the player plays through the Story Mode.

Communication Exchange (つうしんこうかん): This mode allows you to 'trade' characters with another human player via the link cable. However, the player will still get to keep the character(s) that they trade away.

Communication Battle (つうしんたいせん): This mode allows you to compete in a dance with another human player via the link cable. Player 1 is Jagainu-kun while Player 2 is Haripoteto-chan. However, this mode must be unlocked first by unlocking all songs. The player with the highest score wins the game.
title: Jagainu-kun

sample_screenshots.caption: ...then pressing start to make Dash follow the route made...

description: Sequel to Daikaijuu Monogatari: Miracle of the Zone
title: Daikaijū Monogatari: The Miracle of the Zone II

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen/main menu (Germany) with a rough approximation of Oliver Bierhoff

description:
Phenomedia's Moorhuhn franchise makes its first apperance on a console with this title closely based on the original advertisement game.

The player's goal is to shoot Moorhühner for points within 90 seconds, moving a crosshair along a horizontally-scrolling landscape. After every eight shots, the gun must be reloaded. Birds that are farther away gain more points while shooting down balloons or planes deducts points. The game contains three different landscapes (compared to just one in the original) and also introduces bonus items. These items are carried by some birds and are activated when shot. They include weapons like a machine gun or a gun with a wide spread as well as time bonuses.

The game can be played for high score (a high score table is available) and in a tournament mode, which challenges the player with a higher score to reach in each subsequent stage.
title: Die Original Moorhuhnjagd

sample_screenshots.caption: Went to the garage to select my car

description:
Moorhuhn 2: Die Jagd geht weiter is the second handheld game in the franchise. It contains a simplified version of the console/PC version and adds several other game modes.

  • Moorhuhn 2 is the traditional game variant in which the player must shoot at Moorhühner flying by, being awarded more points for hitting birds farther away.
  • In Spinnen spinnen, spiders are hanging by threads and must be hit for points. Hitting them sends the thread spinning, making them harder to hit until they come to rest. A hit must be made within a few seconds or a life is lost. Surviving an entire round adds an additional critter in the next one.
  • Hau das Huhn is a Whac-a-Mole variant in which Moorhühner appear randomly in four different locations and must be hit for points.
  • In Die Moorballons, balloons of various colours are sent flying across the screen, with points being awarded for hitting only the balloons of a given colour.

All modes are played for high scores which are saved in battery-backed RAM.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hau das Huhn - Whac-a-Mole with Moorhühner
Die Moorballons - need to hit red balloons for points

title: Moorhuhn 2: Die Jagd geht weiter

description:
Moorhuhn 3 is the third game in the franchise to appear on the Game Boy Color. It includes a simplified variant of the console/PC game and adds a number of additional mini-games.

  • Moorhuhn 3 is the traditional game in which the player must shoot at birds flying by.
  • Moortris is a Tetris variant (also available as an easter egg in the main version) in which the blocks move from left to right.
  • Fische versenken (also available as a standalone game for PC) simulates dynamite fishing. The dynamite is ignited by pressing a button, but there is no strategy - the score is entirely random.
  • Bandits is a Bank Panic variant. Doors open to reveal Moorhühner - the player must shoot at bandits carrying revolvers or explosives while avoiding shooting friendly birds holding flowers.

All games are played for high score which is saved to battery-backed RAM.
title: Moorhuhn 3 ...es gibt Huhn!

description: Continuing the theme of virtual pets, Animal Breeder 3 allows the player to pick a boy or girl character as an avatar, followed by one kind of animal for a pet. While prepping the pet daily for the 12 upcoming contests to win trophies, it is important to keep it happy with adequate food, exercise, rest and entertainment, or risk losing the neglected pet. The player is also free to connect and interact with a second player.
title: Animal Breeder 3

description: Animal Breeder 4 is the final title of the Animal Breeder quadrilogy. It introduces a lot of new features to the gameplay including pet discipline and currency for purchases. At the same time the gameplay is simplified with some features like mini-games being removed to focus purely on the simulation aspect. Instead of proper competitions, the player sends the virtual pets to auditions and classes for benefits. The goal is to obtain collectibles called picture books.
title: Animal Breeder 4

description: In Animastar GB the player creates a profile and utilizes a system called ANIMA@NET to create, raise, and train a digital monster called an Anima. To progress, the player’s Anima must race against an opponent on a track made up of one to six types of terrain, making use of data cards to determine the outcome of the race. Each winning race grants the player additional data cards. Collecting all types of Anima will promote the player to the position of Animastar.
title: Animastar GB

description:
Adapted from the anime TV series Bomberman B-Daman Bakugaiden, the Bomber robots have a duty to protect the peaceful B-da City from the Dark B-da forces.

The player starts off as one of the five selectable Bomber robots on a board that represents B-da City. Crossing the board squares explores the unrevealed areas, which may reveal NPCs or enemies. Upon encountering an enemy, the player does battle in the form of picking multiple moves to boost stats, execute special moves, make use of battle armor, switch to another character, or retreat.
title: B.B-Daman Bakugaiden: Victory e no Michi

description:
Kikansha Thomas: Sodor-tō no Nakama-Tachi takes Thomas his friends around the island of Sodor. In the Story Mode, the player navigates Thomas down a railway in four different levels to complete transport and delivery tasks that are set by the Fat Controller. Throughout the level, the player will need to play timed minigames to progress, some of which incorporate other engines. Those minigame including engine racing, navigating railway mazes, and pushing a train or truck.

Completing the game unlocks the Minigame Mode, which allows minigames to be played without playing any part of the story. The player also gets access to profiles about the engines of Sodor.
title: Kikansha Thomas: Sodor-tō no Nakama-Tachi

description:
Hello Kitty finds a jar of beads and is eager to craft some nice accessories out of them with her friend Tiny Chum.

The gameplay simply has the player sliding rows and columns of beads to get matches of two or more of the same beads paired with a Hello Kitty head or two (although five of the same kind also counts) within a time limit. The game can be played in either Solo mode or Versus. Ode against the CPU or another player. Completing rounds can unlock printable pictures.
title: Puzzle Collection Hello Kitty no Beads Kōbō

description: Hello Kitty enters a museum in which the player has to navigate her through simple maze-like rooms to reveal a stage picture. Each set our fifteen stages are divided up into three categories consisting of the Flower Path, the Apple Path and the Star Path. In a stage, Hello Kitty’s movement is automatic and the player can only change her movement by manipulating gates. A stage is completed after Hello Kitty walks on the goal point. Finished stages can be revisited in the Museum mode. The revealed pictures can also be printed.
title: Puzzle Collection: Hello Kitty no Magical Museum

description: Hello Kitty wakes up to find her residence Happy House looking pretty empty. The player’s objective is to earn happy points by playing three mini-games to purchase furniture and accessories for the house. Adding items to the house helps to develop Hello Kitty’s character. The player can influence Hello Kitty’s learning capabilities and daily activities, and directly communicate with her via the Mobile GB a adapter, as well as exchange emails with various Sanrio characters and trade collected items with another player.
title: Hello Kitty no Happy House

description: Hello Kitty goes on an adventure across the world to find her good friend Dear Daniel Starr. Stages are divided between different parts of the world. In each stage, the player controls Hello Kitty across platforms towards the exit, while avoiding hazards and enemies, and maintaining the heart meter. Some stage serve purely for exploration and gathering information. Sometimes the player will need to solve questions with multiple choice answers. Outside the main game, the player can text another player, check out the Sanrio Puroland page, and view collected pictures in an album.
title: Hello Kitty no Sweet Adventure: Daniel-kun ni Aitai

description: Dear Daniel Starr missed his good friend Hello Kitty, so he sets off from London on his own world expedition to look for her. The game plays exactly the same as Hello Kitty no Sweet Adventure: Daniel-kun ni Aitai, but the player is in control of Dear Daniel instead of Hello Kitty, and there are different stages, locations, and quiz questions.
title: Dear Daniel no Sweet Adventure: Kitty-chan o Sagashite

description:
The world is at stake as the Galacutasu force rises in power and have their sights set on the protagonists’ hometown. The play as a boy called Ippei or a girl called Mina steps forward to utilize their newly acquired Bright Powers to fight back the evildoers.

The player controls the protagonist to navigate around the town area to interact with people and objects with three verbal commands. To advance, there are puzzles to solve, heroes to acquire, and upcoming opponents to fight. Starting a battle requires the player to transform from the regular attire to a Bright Suit, which is only possible with a Full Changer.
title: Zok Zok Heroes

description:
This Wizardry series spin-off has no proper storyline, but the player is required to lead a party to delve down a 30-level dungeon and slay the demon Cthulhu.

The game combines elements of Wizardry V and Wizardry VI with unique features:

  • Gender has been added as an attribute, each with their own small bonuses and exclusive classes associated with them.
  • Additional classes have been incorporated, including the Archer at the start of the game, and the promotional classes Valiant, Avenger, Musashi, Kunoichi, and Summoner.
  • There are now two equipment slots for each hand, instead of one slot dedicated to a weapon and one for a shield, allowing for dual-wielding.
  • Spells are divided into eight categories. Some of those spells are exclusive to particular classes. The spells also have names that say what they do.
  • Opposite alignments are no longer restricted in a party.
title: Wizardry Empire

description:
Ten years after the defeat on the Ransaku, evil forces have ammassed, seeking the Staff of Resurrection.

Much of the gameplay mechanics are the same as the game's prequel, but makes some small adjustments to character class abilities and the method of upgrading to the promotional classes.
title: Wizardry Empire: Fukkatsu no Tsue

description:
The young chef Yumeni-Chan has a job to do in the restaurant kitchen. With the advice of her mother, pet hamster, and the master chef, Yumeni gets cooking to serve customers on her busiest day yet.

The game follows the formula from its prequel Watashi no Kitchen, from buying ingredients to cooking the dish in the kitchen. A new variety of recipes have been introduced, ranging from French Toast to Strawberry Mousse.
title: Watashi no Restaurant

description:
Yumeni-Chan is learning to become a chef in a kitchen, helped by her mother and pet hamster Ham Ham to face the challenge of cooking increasingly complex dishes.

Making a particular dish requires the player to get the ingredients from a supermarket. Following this, the player must interact with ingredients, utensils, and appliances on the kitchen counter in a specific order to get the dish just right, taking care not to spoil it and to turn the appliances off after use. As the player successfully progresses. The variety of dishes expands, ranging from Omelette to Hamburg Steak. The player can also enter a cooking contest against the master chef.
title: Watashi no Kitchen

description: Based on the comedy show Warau Inu no Bouken: Silly Go Lucky!, the player takes the role of a studio manager, hired to bring in a large audience for the TV show. To do this, the player must win in a variety of 20 timed mini-games, such as a memory game, a hidden object search, and a quiz.
title: Warauinu no Bōken GB: Silly Go Lucky!

description: A group of kids go on a shore fishing expedition under the game warden's nose. Before starting the fishing trip, the player must purchase the ideal equipment with available funds. There five different fishing lakes to choose from. After choosing a suitable location at the waterside, the player has to cast the rod at a moving fish. Upon a successful cast, catching a fish requires moving the hook towards the fish's mouth and reeling it in using button timing and sequences. As the player practices the fishing techniques, the player character's fishing abilities improve and the player can catch bigger and faster fish. New kinds of fish can be collected and saved in a picture book.
title: Tsuri Iko!!

description: The game captures several realistic elements of traditional golf in the gameplay. It can played as a tournament or versus the CPU or another play. The player starts with Momoyo as a playable character, although five others can be unlocked. Each character has their own golf-playing stats. The player then picks a club set to match their level of play. On each turn, the player chooses the tee position, club type, aims the shot and then times the strength of the swing, with the goal of getting the ball in the hole within the par.
title: Golf Daisuki

description: Regular boxing matches are practiced and live competitions are held in the Chiba Gym. The player can do single matches picking one out of eight predefined characters, or do the tournament mode using a character with a custom name, face, trunks, and stats. The custom boxer can be trained for better performance in the boxing ring. Boxing matches in the Tournament mode are scheduled on a calendar.
title: K.O.: The Pro Boxing

description:
This adaptation of Takahiro Kamiya’s manga Hero Hero-kun centers around a sleeping curse on the whole of Ukiuki Town imposed by Suyasuya. The unnamed protagonist is on the case.

Before starting, the player character can be customized by gender and given a four-character name. The player travels between town areas, solving puzzles and interacting with people and objects. The player also makes use of the Yumemakura pillow to travel to the dream world to access the sleeping residents’ dreams. Battles are turn-based, which require the careful use of action points in the gauge to do effective attacks on opponents, which are fought one at a time.
title: Hero Hero-kun

description:
Taking some inspirations from the charater Sushi Seal and the Penicillin rock band, the Inazuma Group are mercilessly bullied by the Polar Bear King, who takes over their part of town. The Inazumas vow to get back their town and expel the Polar Bear King.

The player has a selection of mini-games to play with any of the four Inazumas to get the highest score. The following games are:

  • 10-pin bowling
  • Music rhythm
  • Dance floor
  • Ramen matches
  • Crane game

Winning the games with highest scores grants the player boosts for the group members in the form of cards. During the showdown against the final three bosses, the player can use the collected cards to make the mini-games easier. The final three mini-games are a Space Invaders-styled shooter, a turn-based strategy battle, and a card battle.
title: Azarashi Sentai Inazuma: Doki Doki Daisakusen

description: Taking place in the Shutoko expressway, the player drives down a road to gain the highest rank for the race course while avoiding obstacles (guided by warnings), following directional prompts, and overtaking other opponents. Winning a race earns money, which can be used to buy better parts for the car. The ultimate goal is to win the grand prize quality car.
title: The Shutokō Racing

description: Based on the story of the first and second Les Visiteurs films, the player takes control one of the main characters Jacquouille la Fripouille or Godefroy de Montmirail in platformer levels in five different time periods: The Middle Ages, the Regency Era, the Modern Times, a Dystopian Future, and the Prehistoric Times. The player can counter enemies by jumping on them or using a limited supply of projectiles. Certain levels have boss enemies. In between levels, the player can get assistance from the wizard Eusebius.
title: Les Visiteurs

description: 125 years into the future, in the Akasataro System, the protagonist owns three alien creatures called Qui Qui. The player is required to raise the Qui Qui, helping it to evolve and train. Training is done in the form of mini-game activities and enough experience earned allows the player to increase the Qui Qui's traits. The player also has the opportunity to enter the Qui Qui in random or rival battles against other alien species.. Once enough training and evolution is done, the Qui Qui is ready to enter the three leagues of the Galaxy One competition.
title: Qui Qui

description:
This version of Monopoly is exclusive to Japan and combines the features of the Game Boy and Game Boy Color releases. The game includes a storyline about a group of students in their own club competing in the board game.

The game can be played in Free Play with configurable rules or Competitive Mode. In the Competitive Mode, the player can create a profile and choose one out of eleven board pieces. Opponents in the game are smart, uses optimized strategies in multiple circumstances, and are difficult to beat.
title: DX Monopoly GB

description:
Set in the Setagaya Country club, the player does golfing. There are four different courses including Jungle, Coast, Savanna, and Mystery, which can be played on Easy, Normal, or Hard difficulty. There four different modes in the game:

  • Stroke - A single set of courses are played in a game.
  • Training - A practicing match to get a grip on the gameplay.
  • Transmission - Two players connect together to compete.
  • Tournament - The player plays numerous courses with the goal of winning a trophy.

The game can be played in Easy, Normal, or Hard difficulty, which the kind of clubs available, and the how swing is made. Where the ball travels is affected by the wind direction, the force of the swing, the angle the golfer stands, which part of the ball the club hits, and the terrain the ball lands on.

sample_screenshots.caption: Of course you must do the first courses to do the Mystery one

title: Tokoro-san no Setagaya Country Club

description: A mini-game compilation based on the eponymous comedy group. As Masaru Yamada, it is your job to track down your missing father, meeting colorful characters and performing various inane tasks along the way.
title: Owarai Yowiko no Game Michi: Oyaji Sagashite 3 Choume

description: Honkaku Hanafuda GB is a portable version of three popular two-player card games played with Japanese hanafuda cards: Koi-Koi, Hana-Awase, and Oicho-Kabu. It is based on an earlier console version and includes the same game modes and options, but features a different story mode with different characters, and only includes seven different computer opponents.
title: Honkaku Hanafuda GB

description: Pro Mahjong Tsuwamono GB2 is a mahjong game featuring the likenesses of 16 professional players, and a follow-up to Pro Mahjong Tsuwamono GB. This edition includes a title match mode with six different titles to earn, a free battle mode, and the series' signature mahjong guidance mode with full stat tracking.
title: Pro Mahjong Tsuwamono GB2
